com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class GetTasksRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.GetTasksRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class GetTasksRequest
extends SiperianRequest
    Retrieves a list of tasks belonging to a user, group, or role. The list can be filtered by due date, priority, and status.

    Optional Parameters:

    • task metadata - Sets the filter criteria to apply to tasks for the search.
    • overdue only - Tasks that are overdue, i.e. due date is later than the due date specified in the task metadata, will be returned by setting this filter.
    • summary only - Only task metadata will be returned when set to true.
    • unassigned - Tasks that are not assigned will be returned by setting this filter.
    • canBeAssignedToUser - Tasks that can be assigned to this user will be returned by setting this filter.
    • BDD application name - Include only tasks for a BDD instance.

    Usage Example: The following example retrieves a list of Tasks that are assigned to user siftester and overdue.

    GetTasksRequest request = new GetTasksRequest();
    TaskMetaData taskMetadata = new TaskMetaData(); taskMetadata.setTaskId("1234"); request.setTaskMetaData(taskMetadata);
    request.setOverdueOnly(true);
    GetTasksResponse response = (GetTasksResponse) sipClient.process(request);
    See Also:
    GetTasksRequest, CreateTaskRequest, UpdateTaskRequest, Serialized Form

    API Pair: GetTasksResponse

    API Group: Task

      • setSortCriteria

        public void setSortCriteria(String sortCriteria)
        Criteria for ordering results. A comma-separated string containing names of fields in the package used to return the search data. The direction of sort may also be specified using ASC for ascending and DESC for descending. This is the same as in the ORDER BY clause of a SQL query.

        For example: "LAST_NAME ASC, FIRST_NAME ASC"

        Parameters:
        sortCriteria - Comma separated list of column names.

        public void setRecordsToReturn(int recordsToReturn)

        Parameters:

      • getFirstRecord

        public int getFirstRecord()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        Index of first record to return, starting with 1.

      • setFirstRecord

        public void setFirstRecord(int firstRecord)
        Index of first record to return, starting with 1. The API will return an error if this parameter is set to a negative value or 0. The API will return no records if the first record parameter is set to a value greater than the number of records returned by the original request.

        Parameters:
        firstRecord - Index of first record to return, starting with 1.

      • getReturnTotal

        public boolean getReturnTotal()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        True = Return all records.

        See Also:
        setReturnTotal(boolean)

      • setReturnTotal

        public void setReturnTotal(boolean returnTotal)
        Sets whether to calculate the total number of rows satisfying the search criteria. Setting this parameter to true may have significant performance implications. Calculating the total number of records satisfying the search criteria requires execution of an extra (potentially) expensive query.

        Parameters:
        returnTotal - True - Calculate the total number of records satisfying the search criteria.
